Research · Teaching · Links · CV ·

I am a postdoc working with Péter Koltai and Gary Froyland at FU-Berlin. In 2022 I obtained my PhD under Hil Meijer titled ‘Data, models and transitions in computational neuroscience: bottom-up and top-down approaches’ at the University of Twente, see here.

Research interests:

  • Nonlinear dynamical systems and bifurcation theory
  • Computational neuroscience
  • Machine learning and dynamical systems
  • Network dynamics

News:

  • 04/23: Biophysical neural masses and EEG! Preprint here.
  • 05/23: SIAM DS23 MS12: Community detection in temporal dynamics and the Laplace operator. Talk here.
  • 10/23: NADCOM 23: Interesting workshop on nonautonomous dynamics and critical transitions.
  • 1/24 - 2/24: Visiting Gary Froyland at UNSW, Sydney.
  • 5/24: WINQ workshop on quantum and complex systems, Stockholm.
